preqs: PGW5101 (PGW1101, VCW1101), PGW5102 (PGW1102, VCW1102), PGW5103 (PGW1103, VCW1103), PGW5104 (PGW1104, VCW1104), PGW5105 (PGW1105, VCW1105) Pharmacy practice students taking this unit as an elective, will not be required to be enrolled or have completed the co-requisite units.

rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {3460, 3467, 3468} Do Must have passed 5 (I/W) units in {PGW1101, PGW1102, PGW1103, PGW1104, PGW1105, PGW5101, PGW5102, PGW5103, PGW5104, PGW5105, VCW1101, VCW1102, VCW1103, VCW1104, VCW1105} Otherwise true

description: The unit will examine the effect of systemic medication on wound healing. A number of specific drug classes will be described and discussed in relation to wound healing looking especially at current evidence to support theoretical knowledge. Furthermore, medications used to treat wound complications such as infection and pain will be explored.
faculty: Faculty of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences
